batchRequestWithdraw(address,address,byt.details: Withdraws rewards and reimbursements of multiple requests at once. This function is O(n*m) where n is the number of requests and m is the number of rounds to withdraw per request. This could exceed gas limits, therefore this function should be used only as a utility and not be relied upon by other contracts.

params._contributor: The address that made contributions to the request.
params._count: The number of requests to iterate. If set to 0 or a value larger than the number of request, iterates until the last request.
params._cursor: The request from which to start withdrawing.
params._itemID: The ID of the item with funds to be withdrawn.
params._roundCount: The number of rounds to iterate on each request. If set to 0 or a value larger than the number of rounds a request has, iteration for that request will stop at the last round.
params._roundCursor: The round of each request from where to start withdrawing.

batchRoundWithdraw(address,address,bytes.details: Withdraws rewards and reimbursements of multiple rounds at once. This function is O(n) where n is the number of rounds. This could exceed gas limits, therefore this function should be used only as a utility and not be relied upon by other contracts.

params._contributor: The address that made contributions to the request.
params._count: The number of rounds to iterate. If set to 0 or a value larger than the number of rounds, iterates until the last round.
params._cursor: The round from where to start withdrawing.
params._itemID: The ID of the item with funds to be withdrawn.
params._request: The request from which to withdraw contributions.

devdoc.title: BatchWithdraw Withdraw fees and rewards from contributions to disputes rounds in batches.
